FDG.function_description: Directory view for note-taking management

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the notebook page (page 0) of the note - taking app. They perform a click action on the menu icon located at a specific position on this page. Since there are no further actions provided, the flow ends here with this single click action on the menu icon.

steps.summary: Click the menu icon on the notebook page

FDG.function_description: The current page (after clicking the search icon from the directory view) likely functions as a search interface to find specific notes, folders, or files within the note - taking management system of the Markor app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the directory view page (page 0). The core action is clicking the search icon, which likely transitions to or activates the search interface for finding notes, folders, or files within the Markor app's note - taking management system. There are no branch points or loops as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click the search icon on the directory view page to access the search interface.

FDG.function_description: The current page (a system dialog) allows the user to attempt to restart the Markor app after it has crashed, via the "Open app again" option.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Markor app's main page. When the app crashes, a system dialog appears. The user then clicks the 'Open app again' option in the dialog to attempt restarting the app.

steps.summary: Click 'Open app again' in the crash dialog to restart Markor

FDG.function_description: The current page (notebook directory view) with the more options menu open provides functionality to create a folder, import from device, refresh the directory, or access settings for the note - taking management app.
data_out: menu options (create folder, import, refresh, settings)

core_logic.logic: On the notebook directory page, the user clicks the more options icon to open a menu. From this menu, the user can then choose among mutually exclusive actions: create a folder, import from device, refresh the directory, or access settings.

steps.summary: Click the more options icon to open the menu

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Markor app (accessed via the To-Do tab from the directory view) functions as a text input interface for creating, editing, or managing to - do list - related notes, with additional options for actions like deleting, tagging, and formatting accessible via the bottom toolbar.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the To-Do tab from the directory view to enter the text input interface. Once in the To-Do interface, the user can choose to click the Close (X) button to exit or the Undo button to reverse an action, with these being mutually exclusive choices.

steps.summary: Click To-Do tab to enter the text input interface
Click Close (X) button to exit
Click Undo button to reverse an action

FDG.function_description: The QuickNote page in the Markor app provides a text editing interface with formatting tools to quickly create and edit notes, allowing users to input and style text, and access additional actions via the toolbar and navigation tabs.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the QuickNote page via the QuickNote tab. Once on the QuickNote page, the user can perform various text-editing actions like applying bold, italic, text alignment, code block formatting, accessing more options, deleting content, or undoing actions, with no forced sequence between these formatting/action steps.

steps.summary: Navigate to QuickNote page by clicking QuickNote tab
Apply bold formatting to text
Apply italic formatting to text
Adjust text alignment
Insert code block formatting
Access more options for text editing
Delete content from the note
Undo the last action

FDG.function_description: The current page (More tab in Markor app) provides options for app-related actions like rating, accessing settings/help, contributing (donate, report bugs, translate, view contribution info), and displays app version details.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Notebook page (page 0) and clicks the 'More' tab in the bottom navigation bar. This action navigates to the More page (page 5), where app-related options like rating, settings, help, and contribution actions, along with app version details, are displayed.

steps.summary: Click the 'More' tab in bottom navigation to navigate to the More page.

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a note - editing interface where users can input a title and content for a new note, and also has formatting tools to customize the note's appearance.

Additionally, the user can choose to click various formatting buttons (such as bold, italic, text alignment, code formatting, etc.) or other functional buttons (like undo, more options, image icon) to customize the note's appearance and content as needed.

Click the title input field to prepare for entering the note title
Click the undo arrow button
Click the bold formatting button

Click the text alignment button
Click the code formatting button
Click the more options button

FDG.function_description: The current page (Insert Link dialog) allows users to input a name and a URL/path (or browse the filesystem for a path) to insert a hyperlink into the QuickNote being edited.

core_logic.logic: To insert a hyperlink into a QuickNote, first click the Link button to open the Insert Link dialog. In the dialog, you can either input a name in the Name field, input a URL/Path directly, or browse the filesystem (by clicking BROWSE FILESYSTEM) to select a file/directory path. If browsing, you can navigate folders/files (repeating as needed) and then return to the dialog. Finally, click OK to confirm the link or CANCEL to abort.

Click Name input field to enter link name
Click URL/Path input field to enter link path/URL
Click BROWSE FILESYSTEM to open file browser
Navigate: click Home directory icon
Navigate: click Parent directory (..)
Navigate: click data folder
Navigate: click media folder
Navigate: click QuickNote.md file
Navigate: click todo.txt file
Exit file browser: click Cancel button (returns to Insert Link dialog)
Abort: click CANCEL button (close dialog, return to editor)
Confirm: click OK button (insert link, close dialog)

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Markor app's To-Do tab provides a text input area for creating or editing to - do items, along with a toolbar for various actions (like deletion, tagging, and keyboard control) and navigation tabs for switching between different note - taking/management sections.

FDG.function_description: The current page is a todo detail viewing page with a three - dot menu that provides options for sharing the todo item and formatting it, allowing users to perform actions related to the specific todo entry.

core_logic.logic: On the todo detail page, the user first clicks the three - dot menu button. Then, at the menu page, there is a branch: if the user chooses the 'Share' option, they can proceed to the share sub - menu (e.g., click the 'File' option); if they choose the 'Format' option, they can select from different format options (Markdown, Plain Text, todo.txt) and then return to the todo detail page.

steps.summary: Click the three - dot menu button on the todo detail page
Click the 'Share' option in the three - dot menu
Click the 'File' option in the share sub - menu
Click the 'Format' option in the three - dot menu
Click the 'Markdown' format option and return to the todo detail page
Click the 'Plain Text' format option and return to the todo detail page
Click the 'todo.txt' format option and return to the todo detail page
